string.text: Hey Loris, do you have any work that needs to be done?

Actually I do. The gist is this - a few days ago one of my groups has gone to the Darkscape for a deal with er... A certain group of people. The deal went smoothly, but there was mutual distrust between both parties and things seemed fishy. After the deal, one of my guys named Danila, took notice that the bandits were still hanging around the premises and heard talks of some 'nearby stash' and thus, he made a sketch of a map with a few marked points of interest for us. A couple stalkers have already gone there with the map, but found nothing, so perhaps you'll have better luck.

So you're saying I should be searching for a stash? How come other stalkers didn't find anything after visiting the spots multiple times? Maybe there's nothing there? I mean, I'll gladly do it, I'm just afraid I won't find anything.

Well, the stalkers I sent there were total rookies, some got scared away by mutants, some didn't even thoroughly check the locations we marked. Perhaps you'll have better luck? Anyways, here's the map, please don't lose it.
Darkscape..? Sorry, Loris. I don't feel like going back there, I already visited that place and it sucked big time. I'll have to pass up on this one.
Well, I understand - no one wants to go to the Darkscape in the first place, after all. Maybe I'll manage to convince one of my guys to do it for me.
Loris, I knew it. There's nothing there, it feels like Danila's intel was off.
Damn... It's a shame, really. But I feel like it's no coincidence multiple guys haven't found anything by now.
May I ask what this whole thing is about?

You see, with Sidorovich stomping down on my connections, I had to look for alternatives to keep my business running. I caught word of this one group operating in the Dark Valley and Darkscape who manufacture their own medical kits. They're not as good as the imported orange medkits, however, they're still effective in a pinch and I thought this might be a good thing to sell to the locals who can't afford higher quality medical supplies. The meet I mentioned last time was between that group and my guys, the whole thing seemed a little sketchy.
Interesting. Will I get a reward for my time even if I didn't find anything?

I'm sorry, but I really can't afford to give you a lot. You can have a few of these medical kits that I mentioned and I'll throw in some beer and a little cash for your time and effort. You can also keep the map, Danila said he was going to make a better one.
Hey, Sidorovich, I came to tell you about this one matter that's putting me off. It's about Loris.
Loris?! I already had to go through hell to help him set up his trader outpost at the farm and now he's bringing trouble? Tell me all about this.

Well from what I could piece together, Loris might be doing deals with the Bandits. As I understand, his group had a meeting with some Bandits in the Darkscape and I suspect Loris is buying these less than optimal medkits and selling them out to the local rookies, who probably have no idea about the effects of them. This is pretty messed up, he's putting rookies in danger.

What?! Show me that medkit. Hmmh, it does seem like it's produced by a bandit squad based on all the insignias all over. Now who he does business with is not my problem, but I'm not going to let him endanger my rookies.
So what will you do about this?

Another war in the Cordon is what I need the least, especially after what happened back in 2011. I'll do my best to disrupt his supply lines, maybe sabotage the meets or so. As for now, I want us both to keep quiet about this. But really, thank you for telling me about this, here's a token of my appreciation.
Hey, Novikov. Got any interesting work for me?

I had this one little errand. One of our scouts saw a group of stalker scavengers right at the train in northern Swamps. An emission started right before he could check what they scavenged off that train, so he had to book it.
So? What happened?

He made it back to base empty handed, but he drew this scheme of the train, he said someone might still find something in the vicinity. I would need you to check it out and bring me whatever you find - electronic components, wiring, anything. What do you say?
I'd be down. It doesn't sound overly complicated. Just give me that drawing and I'll check it out.
Here you go... Good luck out there. Just make sure you check the area well.

I'm sorry, but I really don't feel like going around the Great Swamps - one wrong step into the water and I'll be glowing for weeks. Plus the presence of military and bandits closeby doesn't give any sense of safety.
I understand. I'll send someone better equipped there then. Your choice.
Novikov, I'm back. Your guy was right, they left behind what looks like a microchip.
Sweet, I can make use of this. Encountered any trouble on the way there?
Not really. It's nothing I couldn't handle.
Well, thank you for your efforts. Give me that drawing back if you didn't lose it. And here's your reward, a couple medkits Kalancha designed. Stay safe out there.
Cold, do you have any special work for me to do?

You came just at the perfect moment. Mere moments ago Kalancha said he'll be closely inspecting some new anomalous samples - electric artifacts, as stalkers call them. And for this, he needs an entirely new oscillograph that we've rented from Sakharov.
Let me guess, you want me to deliver it?

That's right. Everything's been paid for, so you just need to grab it and bring it back. Just that it's fairly heavy, so think twice before grabbing it from him. And it is fairly expensive lab equipment, so you better take good care of it.
Sure, I can do that. I do expect to be properly rewarded for it, though.
Yes, of course. I will let Sakharov know about your arrival. Good luck, make sure you're not overencumbering yourself with other shit.
Eh, I'm sorry Cold, but I don't feel like lugging such heavy equipment across half the southern Zone.

Well, your choice. Frankly, even if I had an exoskeleton, I wouldn't do it, but I'll find someone else to do this. In the meanwhile, Novikov mentioned he's looking for someone to go scavenge something for him. You could try asking him what's it all about.
Fuck... This thing must weigh a million tons. Here's the apparatus, whatever you said you need it for.
Oh, good, good. Seems to be in working order. Thanks a ton for this, we won't forget your contributions.
What about my reward?

Right, nearly forgot. Here's some of our own produced medical supplies alongside some money. And I'll also throw in one of our left-over backpacks, use it, stash it, do what you want with it. Also Novikov said he needs help - he said he needs people to pick some stuff up for him.
Fuck... This thing must weigh a million tons. Here's the apparatus, whatever you said you need it for.
Oh, good, good. Seems to be in working order. Thanks a ton for this, we won't forget your contributions.
What about my reward?

Right, nearly forgot. Here's some of our own produced medical supplies alongside some money. And I'll also throw in one of our left-over backpacks, use it, stash it, do what you want with it. Also Novikov said he needs help - he said he needs people to pick some stuff up for him.
Hello, professor. I was sent here by Cold from the Great Swamps. I was told I had to pick up some laboratory equipment?

Yes, indeed. I'm sure you were informed that the Oscillograph is fairly heavy, but here it is. Please take care while taking it back to the Swamps, it's an expensive and irreplaceable piece of equipment.
Augh, christ... This thing must weight a million tons. Professor, can I do anything about this? I don't know if I'll make it to the Swamps.
Mmmh... I'm not supposed to do this, but I'll give you this to help bear the weight. Just please don't tell anyone about this. Good luck out there.
